title: Self-DoS due to template injection via email field in password reset form on access.acronis.com

profile.name: Acronis
profile.about: Acronis sets the standard for cyber protection through its backup, anti-ransomware and cyber infrastructure

vulnerability_information:
## Summary
HI acronis security team , how are you
I hope everyone is OK in the other side of the screen .
I found Template Injection in [https://access.acronis.com/reset_password/new] via the mail input .

## Steps To Reproduce:

 1. Open [https://access.acronis.com/reset_password/new] and Enter the mail Payload : sudo_bash{{8*8}}@wearehackerone.com
 2. After submite the mail , The resulte will Reflect in the page with the mail adress .

## Impact

- AngularJs CCTI may lead to xss .

activities.message:
HI ,

Can you give me permission to do more security checks about this vulnerability , I just want to dig deeper about this vulnerability .
.
.
Best regards,

Hi @sudo_bash

Thanks for participating in Acronis bug bounty program!
Our security team usually replies within 1-2 business days.

Meanwhile, I'd recommend you to check out our [policy](https://hackerone.com/acronis).

Hi @sudo_bash 

Based on your initial description, there do not appear to be any security implications as a direct result of this behavior. To me it looks like this falls under "Informative" section of our policy

> Ability to send emails with some user input without any limits

If you disagree, please reply with additional information describing your reasoning. Including a working proof-of-concept can be incredibly helpful in our assessment of these claims. Otherwise, feel free to self-close the report.

P.S. We do not provide test accounts for this system, but I believe you can deploy your own trial instance - https://www.acronis.com/en-us/products/files/trial/#/registration

Let me explain more for you :]
Angular templates can contain expressions — JavaScript-like code snippets inside double curly braces. =={{*}}== , So if Your server does not  forbidden the double curly braces =={{*}}== This means anyone able to inject double curly braces can execute ==AngularJS CSTI== , this vulnerability may lead to XSS that can use to exploit the other users .

so :
In The [Password Reset](https://access.acronis.com/reset_password/new) when i inject the payload : `sudo_bash+{{8*8}}@wearehackerone.com` as an email address It will reflect as : `sudo_bash+64@wearehackerone.com` , as you see in the pictures and the video , every Calculation that i use as payload inside my hackerone mail will executed in the server and return with resulte in the page :

`sudo_bash+{{8*8}}@wearehackerone.com` => `sudo_bash+64@wearehackerone.com`
`sudo_bash+{{9*9}}@wearehackerone.com` => `sudo_bash+81@wearehackerone.com`
`sudo_bash+{{7*7}}@wearehackerone.com` => `sudo_bash+49@wearehackerone.com`
`sudo_bash+{{this}}@wearehackerone.com` => `sudo_bash+"$SCOPE"@wearehackerone.com`
I understand how it works, no need to explain. We'll be waiting for a demonstration of XSS or something else with a meaningful security impact. Otherwise, the report will be closed as informative

## Summary
HI ,
when i inject the Payload : `sudo_bash+{{'a'.constructor.prototype.charAt=[].join;eval('x=1} } };alert(1)//');}}@wearehackerone.com` The Server does not give me any response and time out after about ==90-120== Sec or even more , After That I found that i Can make Dos to any user device using the object `$$watchers` ,  when open URL and click Submite to the payload in the mail input , when I tried That for more than 7 times , every time my device is ==TimeOut== , Literally after ==5 to 7==sec there is no way to use my computer , all my 6 GB ram is full used , Because of that I will have to restart my device , and i reboot my device 6 or more times when I am testing the Vulnerability , I tried the same Thing in my phone , and burp , it is the same result .

## Steps To Reproduce

  1. Open https://access.acronis.com/reset_password/new .
  1. Enter the mail payload : `sudo_bash+{{$$watchers}}@wearehackerone.com` .
  1. After 5 to 6 , the device should timeout , or the browser will close the page automatically .
This looks like temporary self-DoS, and DoS is clearly listed as out of scope in our [policy](https://hackerone.com/acronis)
Closing the report as Informative since the issue exists, but has no security impact.

additional_data.old_title: Template Injection via Password reset Mail input in access.acronis.com
additional_data.new_title: Self-DoS due to template injection via email field in password reset form on access.acronis.com

summaries.content: Self-DoS is possible on https://access.acronis.com due to template injection in password reset form. At the moment, we do not see any security implications as a direct result of this behavior.
